title: Identify the Reaction
text: Write down the balanced chemical equation for the combustion of propane: C₃H₈(g)+5O₂(g)→3CO₂(g)+4H₂O(l).

title: Use the Formula for Enthalpy Change
text: The enthalpy change for the reaction can be calculated using the formula: ΔH° $$=$$ ΣΔHf°(products) - ΣΔHf°(reactants).

title: Calculate the Enthalpy of Products
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of formation for the products: 3CO₂(g) and 4H₂O(l). Use the values: CO₂(g) $$=$$ $$-393.5$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and H₂O(l) $$=$$ $$-285.8$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$.

title: Calculate the Enthalpy of Reactants
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of formation for the reactants: C₃H₈(g) and 5O₂(g). Use the values: C₃H₈(g) $$=$$ $$-104$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and O₂(g) $$=$$ $$0$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$.

title: Find the Enthalpy Change
text: Subtract the total enthalpy of the reactants from the total enthalpy of the products to find the enthalpy change for the reaction.
